intro: Haplostellis, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are characterized by their distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. Haplostellis species are often adapted to saline and windy environments, showcasing their resilience to harsh coastal conditions. The flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in the summer months. They play an important role in stabilizing dunes and supporting coastal biodiversity.
